attributes.action: Urge Saudi government to reduce pilgrimage fees
attributes.background: The British government should help British Muslims by passing the message to the Saudi government that British Muslims are not happy with the Umrah fee. Not every Muslim can’t afford to pay the extra fee
attributes.additional_details: Umrah is a spiritual journey for every Muslim all around the world, but for the last two years the Saudi government has made it harder for Muslims. It’s British parliament responsibility to raise our views with the Saudi government.

attributes.action: Provide loans to help citizens who become seriously ill abroad return home
attributes.background: My uncle, Charlie, had a stroke in Cambodia and was on life support. Repatriation to the UK was £105,000. There must be a contingency plan for sick British nationals with no insurance who need to be repatriated. No British citizen should die because they can't afford medical care.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide a reasonable loan scheme that families can use to get their loved ones home. These loans should be paid back as and when it is realistically possible for the family to do so.

attributes.action: Require free admission for more than one carer with a disabled client.
attributes.background: As a carer for disabled people it frustrates me when myself and other carers take disabled clients to attractions such as the zoo and are unable to get in as they only allow one carer in for free. A lot of individuals with additional needs have two carers for a reason, not just for show.
attributes.additional_details:
So why should the disabled client, that cannot work, have to pay for the second carer to get in when it's ok for one carer to get in for free. I feel like associations do not realise how much this impacts individuals with additional needs enjoying their lives as they cannot afford it. 
The human rights act 1998 states: 
Right of life 
Freedom of assembly and association 
Protection from discrimination 
Right to education 
 
So why is this a issue in disabled individuals lives on a day to day basis. The Government needs to intervene and make this a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Stop using Student Finance as income when calculating Universal Credit benefit.
attributes.background: Student finance is being used as an income when calculating Universal credit entitlement. Student finance is a loan which has to be repaid not an income. This is driving many students into poverty and forcing them to give up leaving them more likely to be reliant on benefits in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Higher education and getting a degree is extremely expensive. Student finance loans helps with this making it accesible to the every day person, to improve their prospects in the long term. The DWP however are taking this loan as an income when working out benefit awards, and reducing entitlement. Pushing them and their children into poverty, causing undue stress and harm and affecting their achievements, simply because they are trying to better themselves, how is the penalisation fair ?

attributes.action: Force companies to pay SIA licensed security officers 40% above the minimum wage
attributes.background: Security Officers over the UK are seriously underpaid, and they take huge risks in the job they are doing because of the growing crime rate and the violence within the UK. This petition would look at setting a standard for licensed SIA officer to be paid 40 percent above the minimal wage

attributes.action: Ban Helium in party balloons.
attributes.background: Helium is used to inflate party balloons. We believe that helium, as a finite resource, should be used exclusively for essential needs such as medial purposes. Party balloons can be used with air to create great displays. Parts of Norway have banned helium for balloons and the UK should follow.
attributes.additional_details:
Norway helium ban
https://www.plasticsoupfoundation.org/en/2018/05/norway-bans-helium-balloons/

Alternative ways to display balloons without using helium
https://www.getpersonalised.net/personalised-balloons/displaying-number-balloons-with-air-lets-stop-the-helium/

attributes.action: Ban Ministers from campaigning during referendum campaigns
attributes.background: It is my view that campaigning by Government Ministers during the previous EU referendum was counter-productive. I would like you to create legislation preventing the government and its ministers campaigning for or against a particular outcome during a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: When the UK electorate has a referendum, the decision has been passed to the electorate, the decision does not belong to the Government. It does not make sense for the Government to campaign for or against a particular outcome. They should attempt to remain neutral. Please note that I am referring to the Government and its Ministers, not MP's.

attributes.action: Seek agreement to extend Article 50 period by one year to achieve best possible
attributes.background: With the government in crisis and running out of time to negotiate a Brexit deal, article 50 must be extended. If the U.K. is to get a good deal, we will need more time. Therefore, Article 50 must be extended to March 29th, 2020 or we risk a catastrophe.

attributes.action: Make charging extortionate amounts for the equivalent gluten free items illegal
attributes.background: Gluten free items are typically at least double or triple the cost of standard items which is essentially exploitation against those genetically susceptible and intolerant/reactive to gluten. Is this not indirect discrimination, treating this population differently? This has been so hard for me.
attributes.additional_details:
A gluten free lifestyle can be tough enough without having to pay extortionate amounts for food and for small amounts. Its been difficult to switch to a gluten free diet not just physically and mentally but also financially. This should not be the case. 
Severe abdominal pain, fatigue, indigestion, bloating, vomiting and anaemia are just a few of the symptoms you can experience by eating gluten with such conditions like Celiac and IBS. Now, thousands of people are affected. We can help them.

attributes.action: Amend the BBC Charter to require it to make achieved content freely available.
attributes.background: The BBC has many decades worth of programming that is currently not available to license paying residents of Britain. As the BBC Charter does not currently mandate that it is made available to said residents it is not possible to watch more than a fraction of this content.
attributes.additional_details: We ask the Parliament and the Government to amend the BBC Charter to require the BBC to make all of its archived content available to license paying British residents.

attributes.action: Introduce a statue of limitations for Army veterans
attributes.background: British Army veterans are being investigated for alleged wrongdoings that took place over 40 years ago in Northern Ireland , even though in many cases they were thoroughly investigated at the time . The introduction of a statute of limitations would prevent this from happening in the future .

attributes.action: Provide higher maintenance loans and make students eligible for benefits
attributes.background:
As per DWP, full - time Students in the UK are currently not entitled to any benefits and are solely dependant on their maintenance loan.

Part-time students may claim limited universal credit and it is hard for them to find part-time work as employer preference remains full-time employment.
attributes.additional_details:
Maintenance Loans are 100% repayable.
Should cover rent + bills + school expenses but is not enough to cover even rent if studying in London.

Part of the maintenance loan is supposed to go towards school expenses - for Art students, this is a particularly large sum.

DWP add the full loan amount into their calculations as income, they do not take substantial expenses, such as deposit towards housing, into consideration as an expense for the student.

It has become a privileged situation to be able to study in this country and this shouldn't be the case when studying towards your first degree. Those who haven't got parents to rely on to fill in the gaps in their budgets and are struggling to find part-time jobs are left with no options.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding Building Contractors they need to be licensed
attributes.background: Building works to adapt my home left my home devestasted, unadapted and with 41500 released to the builder, when it went wrong, I went to trading standards and sought advice,  I was told it was unlikely I would get any of the money back as they can just fold how in 2018 is this possible?
attributes.additional_details: City of York Council disabled facilities grant £30000 a loan of £9000 £2500  savings given legal advice.  This is a real story, I dont want this to happen to anyone else I have contacted my local MP and the BBC the law needs to change.  Sadly this is not an isolated case and it is happening to many innocent people and there is little repurcussion to these unscrupulous traders.

attributes.action: Subsidise train journey for work commuters by offering tax incentive
attributes.background: People who travel more than 60 miles on train to reach office end up spending significant proportion of their take home salary. The government should help such people by offering a scheme similar to cycle to work in which train season tickets for work could be purchased before NI and tax deductions.

attributes.action: Introduce hypothecated tax to support NHS by regulated distribution of cannabis.
attributes.background:
The NHS needs far more money funded from central government in order to continue to provide for everyone's physical and mental health needs in the U.K.
Evidence from some states in the US including Colorado demonstrate that legislative amendments regarding cannabis have produce substantial revenue.
attributes.additional_details:
Colorado has an geographical area similar to the United Kingdom with a population of 5 million, similar in size to Scotland. The Colorado Department of Revenue began collecting data in February 2014. In 2017 over $247 Million was raised. The total economic impact has been calculated at over $1.5 Billion.
Please refer to website link:
www.colorado.gov/pacific/revenue/colorado-marijuana-tax-data

attributes.action: Increase awareness of asthma in under 5 year olds.
attributes.background: The Government must raise awareness among GPs and healthcare professionals to increase the diagnosis of asthma in children under 5. When a child with asthma isn’t diagnosed until they are 5 it is especially hard. I understand it can indicate other conditions but it is a condition that can kill!
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was nearly at the point of having to resuscitate my child, I had inhalers to ease until paramedics arrived but imagine if I didn’t have that “we can’t do anything with children under 5”. Thankfully at the age of 6 months I managed to push and push the doctors for a steroid inhaler alongside his blue inhaler but it took my son to have an asthma attack at 6 months old and a trip to A&E for them to realise.

attributes.action: Introduce a 12-month residency requirement for candidates to Parliament
attributes.background: In order for Parliament to become truly representative, this petition proposes introducing legislation to require persons standing for Parliament to be resident in their constituency for at least 12 months prior to election day.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is meant to be a representative democracy.  However, parties will often choose a favoured member to run for a seat to maximise their chances of winning, even though they have no genuine connection to the local community.  As a result, Parliament is not a collection of community representatives, but a collection of preferred party members.

attributes.action: Review sentencing to ensure it works for single victims of repeated abuse
attributes.background: I want the government to order a review of sentences for abuser. If they commit the same offence towards the same person repeatedly over a period of time, it should be treated much more seriously.
attributes.additional_details: An offender who repeatedly abused children for 10 years was charged with only 11 counts of rape, but the abuse had taken place over 10 years. The amount of time the child has been abused needs to count. The abused child has lost those years. Those 10 years count.

attributes.action: Allow parliamentary time for a Bill for democratic reform of the House of Lords
attributes.background: Between 2001 and 2015 successive parliaments failed to agree on Bills to complete the work of the 1999 House of Lords Act by creating a democratic elected Second Chamber. In the last parliament a House of Lords Reform Bill passed its Second Reading in the Lords but was given no further time.
attributes.additional_details: An elected Second Chamber was first discussed in the 1911 Parliament Act, and again in the 1999 House of Lords Act. In 2015 all the major parties promised Lords reform in their election manifestos, but only a Private Members Bill was brought forward. That Bill was a compromise proposal aimed at finding the consensus which had eluded the attempts of the previous Coalition and Labour Governments. That consensus can only be found if sufficient time is allowed for debate.

attributes.action: Introduce Black History Month to the curriculum for primary and secondary school
attributes.background:
It is vital that we inform the younger generation of the struggles and injustice that was faced by black people. It is imperative that we are all aware of the past and the addition to the curriculum will give all races the opportunity to learn about the past. 

Through knowledge comes progression.

attributes.action: Create a minimum free-to-carry hand luggage allowance for all UK-bound flights.
attributes.background:
Airlines are constantly removing luggage allowances. It started as hold luggage, and now carriers are removing hand luggage allowances too. 

Luggage is an essential part of flying. Being required to pay for it is unfair on the consumers.
attributes.additional_details:
Ryanair has started charging even for hand luggage. It's likely other carriers will follow suit. 

Consumers have no protection from these practices, and ultimately are forced into paying the fees, as a hand luggage allowance is essential to most people when flying. 

The aim of this petition is to encourage the government to make a minimum requirement of free-to-carry hand luggage for flights in/outbound of the UK, so consumers are not forced to pay for every essential thing when flying.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all Police Officers to carry Taser by 2020
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for all Police Officers to carry a Taser gun by 2020 to protect Police Officers and the public.

attributes.action: Let us vote on petitions
attributes.background:
Petitions with 200k signatures should be put to a public vote.
It is unjust & Unfair that Parliament make all the decisions & decide what issues we can/can't vote on, people should make policy, not just parliament, we need more democracy not less! 

Join the campaign @ Let Us Vote on Fb & Twitter
attributes.additional_details:
Our proposal: Applicable petitions would be voted on alongside general elections, if they passed the 200k threshold.

This would give people the power to bring change, It would get people involved, giving us the power to shape Government policy, with a new era of British democracy, where anyone can force change.

It would also stop the discontent for petitions we see now & allow the UK to join the list, of many countries where petitions can force a vote.

Join the campaign. Demand Democracy!

attributes.action: Cut aid to the Palestinian Authority until they stop paying terrorists’ families
attributes.background: In 2017, nearly £280 million was paid out, some of it as stipends to convicted terrorists and their families. Families of individuals killed by Israeli security forces have been paid about $1,000 per month. The families of convicted Palestinians in Israeli prisons can receive $3,000+ per month.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK will provide up to £38 million to the Palestinian Authority in economic aid over the next five years. These payments have to be stopped unless the Palestinian Authority gets rid of their shameful policy. The British Government should also pass legislation similar to the USA's Taylor Force Act.
 
http://www.timesofisrael.com/pa-payments-to-prisoners-martyr-families-now-equal-half-its-foreign-aid/

attributes.action: Reform the sentencing laws for manslaughter and murder
attributes.background: There should be no half sentences and life should mean life for violent and serious crimes. The broad term used for manslaughter needs to be addressed and reformed, there has to be better sentencing to provide justice for the victim and their families when someone has been violently killed.
attributes.additional_details: Manslaughter ranges from one punch to someone stabbing someone who is unarmed multiple times in a sustained and brutal attack. Serving five years of ten in prison is not enough, instead of shutting prisons, there should be enough to allow violent offenders to serve a whole term sentence. Criminals these days know how to play the parole board knowing they may be able to go home halfway through their sentence even though they have taken a life. This situation does not deter violent people from carrying or arming themselves with a knife and ultimately killing someone.

attributes.action: Call for a global moratorium on deforestation.
attributes.background: While high-tech carbon dioxide removal solutions are under development, the “natural technology” of forests is currently the only proven means of removing and storing atmospheric CO2 at a scale that can meaningfully contribute to achieving carbon balance.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.climateandlandusealliance.org/scientists-statement/

attributes.action: Ban e-cigarettes from open display in shops and treat them like tobacco.
attributes.background: E-cigarettes are very popular with teenagers who become addicted to nicotine and turn eventually to tobacco. They should be treated in the same way as tobacco and placed out of view in shops and petrol stations otherwise we will see an epidemic of e-cigarette use, like America, here in our schools.
attributes.additional_details: "E-cigarettes are 75% to as harmful as tobacco" (Stanton Glantz, Professor of Medicine and Tobacco Control, UCSF, 2018). PHE is ignoring the evidence in its claims they are 95% safer! In the US, the FDA is now clamping down hard on the e-cigarette industry (which is mostly the Big Tobacco!) because of the rising epidemic of vaping in high schools. Vaping creates nicotine addiction and teenagers are 4-6 times more likely to try tobacco! Vaping is conditioning us to accept smoking as normal again.

attributes.action:
Stop medicine wastage
Give our unused medicines to developing countries in need
attributes.background:
Tons of unused medicines are returned to pharmacies every year.  These medicines are incinerated rather than re-issued.

Meanwhile developing countries are rife with counterfeit medicines.

Giving our unused unopened medicines to developing countries would relieve sufferring and harm.
attributes.additional_details:
When a medicine is returned to a pharmacy in the UK for whatever reason, we assume that it can't be re-used.  This is not so.  

Medicine wastage in the UK costs the NHS around £300 million with £110 million of pharmaceuticals returned unopened & unused to pharmacies every year.  Instead of re-issuing these medicines they are incinerated.

These drugs should be given to developing countries across the world in the fight against  counterfeit medicines which are rife and are causing actual harm.

attributes.action: Make dentist check ups and all necessary treatments free on the NHS
attributes.background: If I go to a doctor for a check up or with a problem it doesn't cost me anything. Yet if I go to the dentist I have to pay. If I break my arm or need an operation I don't need to pay for it. If I break my tooth or need something done to my teeth I need to pay.
attributes.additional_details: I work hard and pay my national insurance. I should not need to pay for NHS dentists. If I received certain benefits I could get the dentist for free, but as always regular hard working people of the country who don’t qualify for benefits have to pay for everything. Your teeth are important, it's part of your health and can cause major problems if there is something wrong. Nobody should not need to pay to be seen or treated by a dentist on the NHS!

attributes.action: Require restaurants to give a range of vegan and vegetarian options by law
attributes.background: As it stands there is no actual law that states restaurants must provide vegan and vegetarian options. Veganism is on the rise and gaining real growth as its own lifestyle. most of us feel unfairly treated when our options are greatly limited and social interactions are in decline as a result
attributes.additional_details:
The other reasons are simple. While I firmly believe killing animals is wrong and that a plant based diet brings great benefits I accept not everyone will change. But I do believe that everyone is happy to try or at least take pressure away from the animal farming industry. 
The killing of animals for food and the use of what they provide has been linked to cancer, diabetes and other awful diseases by some studies. We pay millions in treating these.

attributes.action: Review eligibility(prior degree) for the Masters loan for the LLM Legal Practice
attributes.background: A long distance Masters degree, which I struggled to pay for in instalments, has now made me ineligible to apply for a Postgraduate loan to study the Legal Practice Course, which I need to become a solicitor. I now face trying to fund this course via expensive loans or not qualifying at all.
attributes.additional_details: Law graduates who struggled to privately fund a Masters as they could not afford the LPC, are not-eligible for the Post graduate loan. The LPC is the main practice course which enables them become Solicitors. The additional LLM on top of the Legal Practice Course(LPC) is an additional dissertation to qualify the LPC for the Masters Loan. I pray that the eligibilty rule which exempts Law graduates with a previous higher qualification from applying for a Masters loan to study the LPC be reviewed.

attributes.action: Don’t scrap the 1p or 2p coin
attributes.background: Recently there have been calls for the 1p and 2p coin to be scrapped. I believe that this would have a huge effect of the UK public, This would mean any tax increases would jump to a minimum of 5p, that has an effect on petrol prices, shop prices would increase, leaving the British public worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets etc would increase prices by 5p per item when they do increase a price, for eg, Mr & Mrs Public go shopping to their local supermarket, the store has had a store wide increase on tinned goods, so the couple buy 20 tins of varied products, all of which have had an increase of 5p, thats an extra £1 on that shop alone, £52 a year rise in costs, that’s just on one example of shopping, let alone the other rises, to jump from a 1p rise to a 5p rise is too much for a lot of people.

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory National Service in the UK
attributes.background: By introducing national service, the government would find it a positive force in promoting social cohesion, which would foster and sustain a more vibrant feeling of patriotism and duty and could give people vital skills.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the government could find a way to run this system effectively and in a way which people would be happy with.

At least one year in Nation Service, it could be run like an apprenticeship system where young people would gain a qualification or trade from 2 years of National Service. All of this can be debated and planned through in Parliament... WE HOPE.

The aim of this is to give people a sense of duty, honor and revive some patriotism in future leaders, workers, parents, and educators, etc. across this country!

attributes.action: Change the policy on Bereavement Benefit.
attributes.background: I lost my husband some years ago, I have two children with my late husband who are both under the age of 16.  I was receiving bereavement benefit which went towards the support of my children, very much like child maintenance.  I then lost this benefit when I started a new relationship.
attributes.additional_details: This benefit would have been paid till the children were 18, however because I have tried to rebuild my life the benefit stops.  I now have to rely on my new partner to support my children.  My view is why are bereaved parents penalised for moving on in their life, yet had my husband not have died he would be paying me child maintenance roughly the same period of time.  It is not fair that any bereaved parent should be penalised.

attributes.action: Remove the use of 'British Empire' in the UK honours system.
attributes.background:
This petition aims to remove the use of 'British Empire' in UK honorary titles, ending the continuation of colonial language. 

E.g. 'Member of The British Empire' (MBE)
E.g. 'Officer of The British Empire (CBE)

Such awards should be reformed, finally bringing these titles into the modern age.

attributes.action: Change the balance of exams and coursework to improve students’ mental health
attributes.background: The 1-9 GCSEs is damaging students’ mental health. Before, when coursework was part of GCSE exams, mental health issues were much lower amongst students. Coincidence? I think not.
attributes.additional_details: A recent survey shows that over 1/4 of UK students suffer from stress related mental illnesses, such as anxiety, and this number is on the increase, with a newly introduced GCSE exam spec that puts more pressure on students than ever before. Suicide rates are increasing. Sign this petition & help improve the education system.

attributes.action: Make it legal for horses to be ridden on pavements and walkways-safer all round!
attributes.background: Accidents involving horses cause serious injury. There are no clear guidelines for drivers in the highway code.  Most are not aware of horse behaviour and how to pass safely. For everyone's benefit, horses and riders are safer on pavements.

attributes.action: Make a legal requirement for the cosmetic industry to state allergens on product
attributes.background: I recently was hospitlised after an allergic reaction to a moisturiser containing peanut oil. This was not clearly visible on the website or bottle. I want to make it a legal requirement for the cosmetic industry to make this clear (emboldened, capitalised) on their products to avoid this happening.
attributes.additional_details: This currently isn’t a legal requirement that companies need to state on products. With the increasing number of nut allergy’s reported each year as well as the number of deaths I think this is extremely important to raise awareness. The NHS reported 4000 new nut allergy’s in 2005 and the number of the diagnosis’ rise each year. It is crucial that more visibility is present in the beauty industry. Some companies name the nuts as clinical terms, making it harder for the sufferer to be aware.

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS' National Child Measurement Programme for children in Year 6
attributes.background: Parents are told their child’s overweight if they're on the 91st centile (14% of Yr 6), but many are healthy. In a vulnerable child, this label can lead to eating disorders and THEN they become unhealthy. The scheme isn't working; child obesity at this age has continued to rise since it began.
attributes.additional_details: This NHS scheme hasn't lowered obesity rates, but much needed funding is spent on this ineffective scheme, as well as support for eating disorders that could have been triggered by it. Schools often feed children unhealthy meals but then weigh them and they are are obese. Eating disorders at this age are highly damaging as they delay puberty; children can't develop and grow, and mental well-being is drastically affected. This happened to me 2 years ago, age 11, when I was deemed 'overweight'.

attributes.action: Make parental alienation a criminal offence
attributes.background: Parental alienation should be included in the definition of the offence of Controlling or Coercive Behaviour. The current offence doesn’t include control through children such as changing arrangements and no shows.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of the problems climate change poses
attributes.background: Already, pupils in Scotland have voiced the opinion about making changes through protests during school. We would like some help to ensure that the world will be safe for years to come. The Government should raise awareness through a campaign.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/feb/15/uk-climate-change-strike-school-pupils-children-environment-protest

attributes.action: More funding for treatment of women's pelvic conditions to reduce waiting times
attributes.background: Women with female-specific pelvic problems such as fibroids, pelvic inflammation and endometriosis may be left in severe pain for months as there is not enough funding to get quick treatment. These conditions despite the awful symptoms, are not considered serious and are massively underfunded.
attributes.additional_details: While the symptoms are not life threatening they are certainly life altering. Just because the help we need as women is more invasive it does not mean we should just be left in pain. It must change. I have endometriosis and have been waiting over 18 weeks since my initial consultation for a laparoscopy. I've been in A&E 5 times whilst waiting for date because the pain is unbearable and no painkillers help. Women must be offered more support.

attributes.action: Introduce a legal age restriction on the use of smart phones.
attributes.background: I believe that smart phone use is damaging our children. Besides being addicted to them, they may be able to access inappropriate material on line - including sites that promote self-harm and suicide, as well as violence and adult content. This simply has to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
I am all for children having a phone, and believe it is a parent's right to know where their child is and what they are doing. But it should not be a smart phone that has all this freedom to search inappropriate material. 
We protect our children from the dangers of alcohol, tobacco and sexual relationships by having laws that state they must be of a certain age. Surely it makes sense to also protect them from the potential minefield that is the world wide web. This is destroying our children.

attributes.action: Allow the possession of a registered pepper spray as a self-defence weapon
attributes.background: In face of looming and spiralling out of control knife and noxious substances, the law abiding citizens and residents have literally no means to protect themselves from thugs, muggings, random knife attacks, gun point attacks, rape and more serious GBHs. We're asking HM government to act now!
attributes.additional_details: In face of looming and spiralling out of control knife and noxious substances, the law abiding citizens and residents have literally no means to protect themselves from thugs, muggings, random knife attacks, gun point attacks, rape and more serious GBHs. We're asking HM government to follow the example of other EU countries such as  Austria, Czech, Denmark, Finland ( en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepper_spray) and allow the possession of a registered pepper spray as a self defence weapon.

attributes.action: Improve treatment and support for patients with small cell lung cancer
attributes.background: Small cell lung cancer is an underfunded type of cancer in the UK. It takes many lives due to its aggressive nature of metastasising rapidly. I want the government to consider improving treatment options and support to improve life expectancy for patients with this condition.

attributes.action: All ‘fox’ hunts to be filmed by 3rd party, to ensure compliance with Hunting Act
attributes.background: Hunting of wild animals using dogs was made illegal in 2004, yet many continue to do it. Alternative hunts have been created in which dogs follow pre-placed scents, however many still attack wild animals. We believe the following further measures need to be taken:
attributes.additional_details:
- Dogs taking part in the hunt should be muzzled. They are only animals and do not know they should be following the pre-placed scent. It is the owners’ responsibility to ensure wild animals aren’t harmed.
- Hunts should be filmed. The whole hunt should be filmed, paid for by the organised hunt group, and the footage reviewed by a third party to make sure it is compliant with 2004 Hunting Act. Any illegal activity should be passed over to the police for prosecution.

attributes.action: Discuss how supported employment can be made mandatory to include the disabled.
attributes.background:
Looking at figures of the employment sector it is noted that 80% of people without any health barrier are employed compared to people who have health barriers at shocking low of 43.6%.

Figures like these are shocking and need to be addressed such as employers attiude towards disability.
attributes.additional_details:
Below is a link of how supported employment can change and help a person with barriers make the economy and society whole.

This petition is the beginning of inclusion and wider understanding of disability towards recruitment processes within the private, public and self employed organisations.

https://www.mylondon.news/news/south-london-news/unsung-hero-who-helps-disabled-15510468

attributes.action: Allow same sex male couple to have IVF on the NHS just like everyone else
attributes.background: Under the NHS a straight couple, lesbian couple and other couples are allowed to have IVF paid for by the NHS but a gay male couple isn’t allowed to have IVF funded for by the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Me and my husband have been wanting to do IVF but we would have to pay over £5000 to have a child. 
But if we where single or in a straight/lesbian relationship we cannot get any help from the NHS. Please help change this by signing this petition.

attributes.action: Products containing toxic substances to animals display warning labels clearly
attributes.background: This Christmas we purchased a snow tipped tree. Nowhere on the information provided from the company selling this product did it say the paint used on the snow tips was toxic to animals. My kitten died suddenly from ingesting the toxin from the snow tips.

attributes.action: A general election to be called and a no deal to be put in place immediatly
attributes.background: A general election should be called and a no deal annouced. The people should have the right to vote to see which party should take us forward after the EU brexit deadline has passed
